result.execSummary:
The defendant Mindy A Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Def's Motion for Modification of bond

10 am Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JSS violations--  Court:  It looks like we're off with a pretty rough start with bail monitoring.  Failed to report to JSS to complee a compass.  Four attempts to contact her.  She finally appeared.  Missed UA tests...  Ms. Wood, I have a couple of options; I can release you to the community on bond.  That's what's happening now.  The other option is that I can give you a cash incentive to comply with bond.  If it's not posted, you'll remain in custody until the case is concluded.  Wood states she's called and left them messages.  I"m running around with 4 kids and pulling my hair out...  
COURT:  You're expected to abide by the bond.  If not, that leaves me with the option of a cash bond.
Kisken asks that the UA testing be dropped.
COURT:  You can file a motion.  I'm not going to reward her.  In the mean time, you need to comply with the conditons of bond.
GLD: set for hearing
